name: CKEDITOR.focusManager
doc:
Manages the focus activity in an editor instance. This class is to be used mainly by UI elements coders when adding interface elements that need to set the focus state of the editor.

var focusManager = new CKEDITOR.focusManager( editor );
focusManager.focus();

members.name: currentActive
members.doc: Indicate the currently focused DOM element that makes the editor activated.

members.name: hasFocus
members.doc:
Indicates that the editor instance has focus.

alert( CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.focusManager.hasFocus ); // e.g. true
members.short_doc: Indicates that the editor instance has focus. ...

members.name: add
members.doc: Register an UI DOM element to the focus manager, which will make the focus manager "hasFocus" once input focus is relieved on the element, it's to be used by plugins to expand the jurisdiction of the editor focus.

params.name: element
params.doc: The container (top most) element of one UI part.

params.name: isCapture
params.doc: If specified CKEDITOR.event.useCapture will be used when listening to the focus event.

members.short_doc:
Register an UI DOM element to the focus manager, which will make the focus manager "hasFocus"
once input focus is rel...

members.name: blur
members.doc:
Used to indicate that the editor instance has been deactivated by the specified element which has just lost focus.

Note: that this functions acts asynchronously with a delay of 100ms to avoid temporary deactivation. Use instead the noDelay parameter to deactivate immediately.

var editor = CKEDITOR.instances.editor1;
editor.focusManager.blur();
members.short_doc:
Used to indicate that the editor instance has been deactivated by the specified
element which has just lost focus. ...

members.name: focus
members.doc:
Indicate this editor instance is activated (due to DOM focus change), the activated state is a symbolic indicator of an active user interaction session.

Note: This method will not introduce UI focus impact on DOM, it's here to record editor UI focus state internally. If you want to make the cursor blink inside of the editable, use CKEDITOR.editor.focus instead.

var editor = CKEDITOR.instances.editor1;
editor.focusManage.focus( editor.editable() );
members.short_doc:
Indicate this editor instance is activated (due to DOM focus change),
the activated state is a symbolic indicator of ...

members.name: lock
members.doc: Prevent from changing the focus manager state until next unlock is called.
members.short_doc: Prevent from changing the focus manager state until next unlock is called. ...

members.name: remove
members.doc: Dismiss an element from the the focus manager delegations added by add.

params.name: element
params.doc: The element to be removed from the focusmanager.

members.short_doc: Dismiss an element from the the focus manager delegations added by add. ...

members.name: unlock
members.doc: Restore the automatic focus management, if lock is called.
members.short_doc: Restore the automatic focus management, if lock is called. ...

short_doc: Manages the focus activity in an editor instance. ...
